title: Loan Processing Lead Job at TeamAce Limited
content:
At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loan Processing Lead

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Loan Processing Lead to oversee and manage end-to-end loan processing operations.
	This role is responsible for leading a team of loan processors, ensuring timely and accurate loan documentation, compliance with lending policies, and delivering a seamless experience for customers.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in loan operations, credit analysis, and team leadership.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate daily loan processing activities from application to disbursement.
	Review loan files to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with company policies and regulatory standards.
	Collaborate with credit analysts, underwriters, legal teams, and relationship managers to resolve discrepancies and streamline processing workflows.
	Monitor and report key performance indicators (KPIs) related to loan processing efficiency and accuracy.
	Serve as the point of escalation for complex or high-risk loan files.
	Ensure adherence to service-level agreements (SLAs) for loan turnaround times.
	Provide leadership, training, and performance management for loan processing staff.
	Identify process improvement opportunities and contribute to the enhancement of loan systems and operational procedures.
	Maintain strong documentation and audit trails for internal and external reviews.
	Stay informed of industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices in loan operations.


Qualifications


	HND / BSc in Finance, Business Administration, Banking, or a related field.
	3 - 4 years of experience in loan operations or processing, with at least 1 - 2 years in a leadership or supervisory role.
	Certification in credit/lending or financial services operations is a plus.
	Strong understanding of lending processes, credit evaluation, and loan documentation.
	Knowledge of applicable regulatory guidelines and compliance standards.
	Excellent organizational, analytical, and decision-making skills.
	Strong interpersonal and communication abilities.
	Proficiency in loan management systems and Google workspace/microsoft office tools.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (Negotiable) and benefit packages.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
	Health insurance and pension, etc.

title: Office Assistant Job at Gbenga Badejo and Co.
content:
Gbenga Badejo and Co. - Our client, a Professional Services Firm based in Ikeja, Lagos State, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Filing documents, organising records and maintaining filing systems.
	Handling phone calls, directing calls to the appropriate personnel.
	Ensuring shared office spaces are tidy and organized.
	Handling incoming and outgoing emails.
	Scheduling appointments and maintaining visitor logs.
	Monitoring and ordering office supplies and keeping stocks organized.
	Assist with general office operations, including running errands to support administrative and clerical functions.


Education and Requirements


	National Diploma, AAT or equivalent is preferred.
	Minimum of one to two years of experience working in the same capacity.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.


Key Competencies:


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to maintain accurate data entry and document preparation
	Ability to manage files, schedule tasks and maintain records efficiently.
	Ability to work well with other staff and departments.


Salary
N50,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 1 week hereof.
	Male Candidates will be preferred for gender balance.

title: Sales Executive Job at Dragnet Solutions
content:
Dragnet Solutions is a firm that specializes in the design, development and implementation of people screening solutions that can be deployed in a variety of uses covering both the workplace and the educational arena.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	To manage customer accounts, follow up, and meet with assigned customers in the coverage area.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Implement Accounts sales plan and planning agreements, in order to ensure annual sales objectives are achieved.
	Focus on annual / quarterly cost triggers related to customer prices and implement or negotiate where necessary.
	Investigate new opportunities to increase our market share, in order to expand current business relationships and increase the value of customer accounts.
	Focus on stock levels, ensuring slow moving stock is attended to quickly.
	Maintain frequent communication and make planned visits to customers to evaluate and resolve complaints and continuously reinforce relations to increase customer satisfaction.
	Review Customer Accounts results on a monthly basis, explain the reasons for any deviations and take corrective actions, in order to be aligned with the agreed budget and planning agreement.
	Gain in-depth knowledge of customers’ cyclical demand to improve service and recognize opportunities. Use this information to gather forecasts and share with the planner to facilitate the demand plans
	Provide ongoing (dynamic) analysis of market conditions and competitor activity to the company management and sales force to keep them informed about the market trends.
	Negotiate and implement the annual business budget and planning agreements, in line with sales turnover, profitability and other KPIs, to achieve agreed profits.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Marketing or other sales related fields
	4-6 years of experience
	Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics Navision or any other Enterprise resource planning (ERP) software
	Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint Presentation
	Experience in the commercial / sales area from a B2B company
	Experience in logistics / manufacturing sector is preferable.
